tika.dc.description:
• Captures the value of experience so that parents feel they are not alone and are encouraged by the stories of other parents
  • Unlike other guides this uniquely combines real-life stories with practical information, making it more than a dry medical manual
  • With 1 in 20 people being diagonosed as dyslexic or dyspraxic, parents are crying out for advice

This book provides parents with information about dyslexia and dyspraxia and gives them practical ways to help their child, from understanding and recognising the symptoms to getting support from schools and other networks. Using real-life experiences this guide gives essential advice to parents wanting to care for their child.
